feed.title: Review: L.A. Noire
feed.subtitle: At its core, L.A. Noire is a third-person action/adventure game in which you guide our hero through numerous challenges both intellectual and physical.

category.term: 317~L.A. Noire (Video Game)~Los Angeles~Rockstar Games Inc.~Cole Phelps
category.label: InformQString

content.div:
Platforms: X360, PS3

The Deal: When it comes to innovation, depth of play and brilliant storytelling, nobody does it better than Rockstar Games. With the blockbuster franchise "Grand Theft Auto," Western-themed smash "Red Dead Redemption" and brilliantly creepy "Manhunt" among its successes, it's hard to imagine the company ever doing wrong in the eyes of the gaming community. Now, thanks to the many advances in technology and a market craving a new action/adventure game, Rockstar is ready to deliver a masterpiece filled with crime and conspiracy set against a backdrop of Golden Age Los Angeles.

The year is 1947. The war is finally over, industry is growing, and the streets have never been more dangerous. Enter Cole Phelps. This LAPD beat cop needs to use every ounce of his deductive reasoning, police training and pure luck to solve a series of violent crimes as he attempts to make his way up the ranks of the department. As you leap into the capable shoes of Officer Phelps, you will need to search for evidence, interrogate suspects and engage criminals in deadly combat as you slowly bring an end to crime in Los Angeles.

At its core, "L.A. Noire" is a third-person action/adventure game in which you guide our hero through numerous challenges both intellectual and physical. As the story begins to unfold, you will find yourself at the heart of crime scenes searching the locations for viable clues and possible suspects. While gathering evidence may seem like a thrilling activity for crime show enthusiasts, the game truly shines when the character interactions begin. Using a new animation method that consists of multiple HD cameras filming the actors, Rockstar was able to create fully rendered characters that capture every wink, smile and sneer made by their real-world counterparts. With this type of depth added to the characters' performance, you can tell if a suspect is telling the truth based purely on facial expressions. If you're worried that the game won't deliver on the action, fear not. "L.A. Noire" is filled with enough gun battles, fistfights and car chases to keep all the "Grand Theft Auto" fans very happy.

Rockstar has always managed to create an addictive gaming experience capable of stealing endless hours away from gamers around the world. Nowtake that same never-miss formula and add in a beautifully rendered setting, intense action, lifelike character models and a thrilling story, and not only do you have "L.A. Noire" but a reason to never leave your console again.
